data.chText: 魔王；魔鬼；撒旦

before.chText: 基督教、犹太教和伊斯兰教
before.enText: in the Christian, Jewish and Muslim religions

data.enText: the most powerful evil being

data.chText: 魔王；魔鬼；恶魔
data.enText: an evil spirit

data.chText: 他们认为她是魔鬼附身。
data.enText: They believed she was possessed by devils.

data.chText: 淘气鬼；冒失鬼；调皮鬼
data.enText: a person who behaves badly, especially a child

data.chText: 小淘气鬼
data.enText: a naughty little devil

data.chText: （强调对某人的看法）人，家伙
data.enText: used to talk about sb and to emphasize an opinion that you have of them

data.chText: 老家伙这一走，我还真想他。
data.enText: I miss the old devil, now that he's gone.

data.chText: 她去希腊一个月——真是个幸运儿！
data.enText: She's off to Greece for a month─lucky devil!
be a devil

data.chText: （用以鼓励）别怕，勇敢点
data.enText: people say Be a devil! to encourage sb to do sth that they are not sure about doing

data.chText: 来，怕什么，两个都买了吧！
data.enText: Go on, be a devil, buy both of them.
better the devil you know (than the devil you don't)

data.chText: 熟悉的魔鬼比不熟悉的魔鬼好；不要嫌熟悉的环境不好，换个不熟悉的环境可能更糟
data.enText: used to say that it is easier and wiser to stay in a bad situation that you know and can deal with rather than change to a new situation which may be much worse
between the devil and the deep blue sea

data.chText: 进退维谷；左右为难
data.enText: in a difficult situation where there are two equally unpleasant or unacceptable choices
the devil

data.chText: 非常困难；令人非常不快
data.enText: very difficult or unpleasant

data.chText: 这些浆果太小了，很难摘。
data.enText: These berries are the devil to pick because they're so small.
the devil looks after his own

data.chText: 坏人多好运；坏蛋自有鬼照顾；恶人自有恶人帮
data.enText: bad people often seem to have good luck
the devil makes work for idle hands

data.chText: 人闲生是非
data.enText: people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

data.chText: 她认为那些违法行为是当地的无业青少年所为，总是说：“人一闲，惹麻烦”。
data.enText: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.
a devil of a job/time

data.chText: 费力（或令人讨厌）的事；难熬（或令人不快）的日子
data.enText: a very difficult or unpleasant job or time

data.chText: 我费了九牛二虎之力才找到你。
data.enText: I've had a devil of a job finding you.
go to the devil!

data.chText: 滚开；见鬼去；去你的
data.enText: used, in an unfriendly way, to tell sb to go away
like the devil

data.chText: 拼命；卖力；飞快
data.enText: very hard, fast, etc.

data.chText: 我们跑得飞快。
data.enText: We ran like the devil.
speak/talk of the devil

data.chText: 说到某人，某人就到
data.enText: people say speak/talk of the devil when sb they have been talking about appears unexpectedly

data.chText: 嗬，说曹操，曹操就到——瞧，艾丽斯这不来啦！
data.enText: Well, speak of the devil─here's Alice now!
what, where, who, why, etc. the devil…

data.chText: （用于问句表示烦恼或吃惊）究竟…，到底…
data.enText: used in questions to show that you are annoyed or surprised

data.chText: 你到底想干什么？
data.enText: What the devil do you think you're doing?
the devil/hell to pay

data.chText: 大麻烦；大乱子
data.enText: a lot of trouble

data.chText: 一旦他发现了真相，那麻烦就大了。
data.enText: There'll be hell to pay when he finds out.

simple_means.memory_skill: de 加强 + vil 卑劣 → 卑劣到极点 → 魔鬼

means: 〈美口〉虐待；用辣子烤(肉等)；(用切碎机)切碎

data.enText: be a devil

data.chText: （用以鼓励）别怕，勇敢点
data.enText: people say Be a devil! to encourage sb to do sth that they are not sure about doing

data.chText: 来，怕什么，两个都买了吧！
data.enText: Go on, be a devil, buy both of them.

tr: a word used in exclamations of confusion
a rowdy or mischievous person (usually a young man)
example: he chased the young hellions out of his yard

tr: a cruel wicked and inhuman person
coat or stuff with a spicy paste

example: Mosquitoes buzzing in my ear really bothers me
It irritates me that she never closes the door after she leaves

value.def: In Judaism, Christianity, and Islam, the Devil is the most powerful evil spirit.
value.tran: (犹太教、基督教和伊斯兰教中的)魔王，撒旦

example.ex: ...the idea of angels with wings and devils with horns and hoofs.
example.tran: 天使长着翅膀、魔鬼长着角和蹄这样的观念

value.def: You can use devil to emphasize the way you feel about someone. For example, if you call someone a poor devil, you are saying that you feel sorry for them. You can call someone you are fond of but who sometimes annoys or irritates you an old devil or a little devil .

example.ex: I felt sorry for Blake, poor devil...
example.tran: 我替布莱克感到难过，这个可怜的家伙。

example.ex: Manfred, you're a suspicious old devil...
example.tran: 曼弗雷德，你是个可疑的老家伙。

example.ex: Susie, you're a determined little devil.
example.tran: 苏茜，你真是个坚决的小家伙。

value.def: If you refer to someone as a devil, you mean that they do not behave very well but you like them and are not angry with them.

example.ex: 'I think he was a bit of a devil,' Constance said.
example.tran: “我想他有点儿淘气，”康斯坦丝说道。

value.def: Devil can be used to emphasize what you think about someone or something. For example, if you say that someone is a devil of a nuisance, you mean that they are very annoying. If you say that something is a devil of a problem, you mean that it is a very difficult problem.

example.ex: He was always a devil of a nuisance...
It's a devil of a tricky problem,isn't it?
example.tran: 这是个非常棘手的问题，不是吗？

value.tran: (用于强调)极其讨厌（或糟糕、麻烦）的

value.def: If you say better the devil you know or better the devil you know than the devil you don't know, you mean that you would prefer to have contact with or do business with a person you already know, even though you don't like them, than with a person you don't know.
value.tran: 宁可跟熟识的魔鬼打交道(也比跟未知的魔鬼打交道好)

value.def: If you say that you had the devil's own job to do something or that you had a devil of a job doing something, you are emphasizing that it was difficult to do it.

example.ex: We had the devil's own job to persuade him to take part.
example.tran: 我们说服他参加可费了一番周折。

value.tran: (用于强调)需煞费苦心（做），要大费周折（做）

value.def: If you say that someone does something like the devil, you are emphasizing that they put a lot of effort into it. If you say that someone drives like the devil, you are emphasizing that they drive very fast.

example.ex: He drives himself on, working like the devil from seven in the morning until midnight...
example.tran: 他不断敦促自己，从早上 7 点一直拼命工作到午夜。

example.ex: He must have driven like the devil.
example.tran: 他一定是把车开得飞快。

value.tran: 拼命地;竭力地;（开车）飞快地

value.def: You can say the devil take the hindmost to describe or comment on a situation you disapprove of because people do only what is best for themselves without thinking about other people.

example.ex: Every one for himself and the devil take the hindmost.
example.tran: 人人都只考虑自己，谁落后谁倒霉。

value.tran: 落后者遭殃(形容或评论人人都只考虑自己而不顾别人)

value.def: If you say that you are between the devil and the deep blue sea, you mean that you are in a difficult situation where you have to choose between two equally unpleasant courses of action.
If you say that someone has sold their soul to the devil, you mean that you disapprove of them because they have done something that you think is not right in order to get what they want.
People say speak of the devil, or in British English talk of the devil, if someone they have just been talking about appears unexpectedly.
When you want to emphasize how annoyed or surprised you are, you can use an expression such as what the devil ,how the devil, or why the devil .

example.ex: Tim wondered how the devil they had managed it...
example.tran: 蒂姆想知道他们究竟是怎么做到的。

example.ex: 'Why the devil did you do that?'

trans: 拼命地;竭力地;（开车）飞快地
口语]报复地；猛烈地；拼命地
水果魔鬼；水果恶魔；水果小恶魔；爱吃水果的小恶魔
初音；八王子；超能力魔法；小恶魔

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 加强 + vil 卑劣 → 卑劣到极点 → 魔鬼
de 加强 + vil 卑劣 + try → 卑劣的行为 → 恶行
e 加强 + vil 卑劣 → 十分卑劣 → 邪恶
re 一再 + vil 卑劣 + e → 一再做卑劣的事 → 辱骂〔别人〕
vil 卑劣 + ify 使… → 使别人成为卑劣的人 → 诽谤
vill〔= vil〕卑劣 + ain 表人 → 坏蛋，恶棍
